title: Dragan Stančić
text:
Dragan Stančić (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic%20alphabet">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Драган Станчић; born February 12, 1982), also known as "Feng Jinlong" (<a href="Chinese%20language">Chinese</a>: 冯金龙) in China, is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> coach and former football player.
Career.
Stančić has been a member of the <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Serbian under-19</a> and <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">under-21</a> teams. He started his career at <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star Belgrade</a> before playing for <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Belgrade</a> and later <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Kula">Hajduk Kula</a>, only to come back to where he started, at <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star</a> prior to the <a href="Serbian%20Superliga%202007-08">Serbian Superliga 2007-08</a> season.
He moved to China and joined <a href="Qingdao%20Jonoon">Qingdao Jonoon</a> in 2008.
He was part of the Serbia U-21 team that played in the <a href="2004%20UEFA%20European%20Under-21%20Football%20Championship">2004 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship</a>.
